overview: This subject covers key elements of building services and sustainability at a residential and commercial scale. The subject aims to teach the basic terminology and concepts behind providing comfortable and effectively functioning buildings in terms of sun, envelope, services (water, waste, gas, electricity, data, fire protection), heating and cooling, air quality, acoustics and vertical transport. Using the sustainability tools being used in the industry (FirstRate5, and Green Star) students will be given a framework in which to understand how buildings perform and their impact on the environment.

intended learning outcomes: Understand the terminology, principles and techniques of environmental control systems at both small and medium scale;
Integrate environmental controls into architectural designs in a sustainable manner.

necessary pre-requisite: Completion of 50 points of Architecture or Construction major subjects prior to taking the subject
additional pre-requisite: Admission into the B-ENVS Bachelor of Environments

assessments.description: Assignment 1:submission of a set of 10 A3 drawings that includes layouts, schematics, description and justification of environmental systems and services.. 1500 words (equivalent)

Progression on Assignment 1: Progression on Assignment 1 is a pin-up presentation of a set of 3 A3 Drawings (Site plan, Passive Strategy and Energy assessment) that takes place at the beginning of week 3 tutorial.. 3 minutes

Semester 1.Contact hours: 2 hours of lectures and 2 hours of tutorials per week.

Recommended texts and other resources: Alison Kwok,The Green Studio Handbook: Environmental Strategie, 2nd Edition.
